New Records: José Ramírez became the second player in MLB history to have a 39-39-40 season, along with Alfonso Soriano
Key Match Events: The game was cancelled due to inclement weather and less-than-ideal field conditions, with the decision made to prioritize player health for the postseason
Pre-Game Insights: José Ramírez had a chance to achieve a 40-40-40 season, but the game was cancelled before he could attempt it
Post-Match Reflections: José Ramírez expressed his desire to achieve a 40-40-40 season next year, with manager Stephen Vogt stating that he believes Ramírez would have achieved it if the game had been played
Miscellaneous Highlights: The cancellation of the game meant that the Guardians will play the winner of the Astros-Tigers series in the AL Wild Card Series
